alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 3:24PM MST until August 19 at 5:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Pima County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 515 PM MST. * At 324 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain along Highway 86 near the San Simon and Hickiwan washes. Radar estimates between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pisinemo, San Simon and San Simon West. This includes the following streams and drainages... Gu Vo Wash, San Simon Wash, Pisinimo Wash and Hickiwan Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
